channel.title: Crysis 2
channel.description:
So, it was released today, in England anyway, not sure about the other regions. I had it pre ordered just under a month ago, so I got the limited edition (at no extra cost).
My impressions of the demo were amazing, and after 3 or so hours of playing the campaign, my opinion remains unchanged. The cutscenes are truly amazing, particularly the ones at the beginning, and the explosion graphics (and everything else) looks spectacular. Combat and AI has definitely improved greatly from the first one.
Anyone got it yet? How's it run for you? Post your rig if you want. ;) Oh, and I'm playing on PC.

@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Crysis 2 sucks graphics wise compared to Crysis 1 I think the graphics are horrible compared to the original crysis I guess this is due to the fact that they brought it to consoles so graphics had to be downgraded idk. I finished the campaign it was interesting at first then about 1/3 the way through it just got repetitive but I finished it just to get it done and uninstall it.

item.title: Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Agreed it isn’t anything particularly novel or spectacular, but it still a damn good game. The campaign is actually a decent length and stays reasonably fresh. The excellent level design keeps it from seeming linear. I particularly enjoy the ability to switch between stealth and run and gun tactics whenever the hell you want, as the sniping can be quite fun.

Definitely the best FPS I’ve played since the first Crysis.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 2
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Frell:

Once I saw it was New York i knew it would be retarded. The whole tropic thing made it unique…

A lot of the campaign isn’t in the city as such, it’s often in the outskirts, where there are lots of trees and stuff so it’s still pretty.

Completed the campaign, honestly the best game I’ve ever played, it’s like a mix of Halo 3 (aliens and weapons in general), Gears of War 2 (sheer epicness of everything, and the huge scale of some of the alien structures and monsters) and Half Life 2 (the smartness, the awesome and long campaign).

Read full topic

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:387960”]I just finished playing it for an hour or two, but I feel like I played it before…

Oh, that’s right, I have, Half-life 2, it’s the same game… I’m pretty disappointed, I loved Crysis. (oh, and by the way, no ability to customize graphics is not a feature, it’s a LACK of a feature)[/quote]
Just with better graphics.
And yes, agreed there, but with the amount of people complaining about it I imagine they’ll release a patch to enable customisation in the near future.
